availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sarah Eliza Glave Goddard (Mercer County, Kentucky, resident. Wife of William Wirt Goddard)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, resident. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Daughter of William B. Glave and Rebecca Manlove Glave. Married to William Wirt Glade on January 29, 1857 in Harrison County, Kentucky. Mother of Glave Goddard, Nicholas Goddard, Mary Goddard Curry, and Rebel Goddard. Resident in Harrison County in 1850. Household owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Resident in Mercer County in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 62A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 333.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 48.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 52A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 5, p. 515A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #41227.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216888.
"Sarah E. Glave Goddard (1832-1918)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15192452, accessed April 1, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15192452.
